posts.post: Anyone else hate being a Pisces?
posts.Post Summary:
The adaptive self state in the post is composed of the relating behavior exhibited in the writer's sharing of his suffering online. 
the maladaptive self state in the post is composed of the self-criticising statement about how the writer hates himself and the qualities that he associates with his astral sign.

posts.post:
Anxiety being alone
What do you do about when you live alone have no friends. No significant other no family and work by yourself?
posts.Post Summary: The self-state identified in this post reflects an anxious affect regarding being alone, accompanied by feelings of loneliness. This may involve elements of self-criticism or a perception of others as detached.

Anxiety being alone
What do you do about when you live alone have no friends. No significant other no family and work by yourself?

posts.post:
Looking for someone who understand me and offer support in real life.
I'm depressed. I suffer from anxiety. Struggle everyday to get out of bed and work and to see the point of life. No one seems to understand the agony life is. I have no children . I'm 40 and live alone. My boyfriend left me in January but continues to contact me. I miss him horribly everyday but struggling with the fact he left me and has lied to me.
posts.Post Summary:
Two distinct self-states are evident:

The adaptive self-state reflects a desire for self-care through seeking support from others, grounded in the belief that others can help and provide connection.

The maladaptive self-state includes an expectation that her relational needs may go unmet and a perception of others as detached, exemplified by her ex-boyfriend who lied and left her. This state is accompanied by a depressed affect.

B-S.highlighted_evidence: Looking for someone who understand me and offer support in real life

C-O.Category: (1) Perception of the other as related
C-O.highlighted_evidence: someone who understand me and offer support

D.highlighted_evidence: Looking for someone who understand me and offer support

A.highlighted_evidence: I'm depressed. I suffer from anxiety. Struggle everyday to get out of bed and work and to see the point of life. No one seems to understand the agony life is.

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: struggling with the fact he left me and has lied to me

D.Category: (2) Expectation that relatedness needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: struggling with the fact he left me

posts.post:
Yearning for someone to talk to or be with when I have anxiety.
But everyone has their own lives. I can't cope being alone yet I live alone and find no understanding or solace in others company.
posts.Post Summary:
The adaptive self-state is evident in her efforts to seek self-care.

The maladaptive self-state is reflected in anxiety and a perception of others as detached, living their own lives. Additionally, there is self-blame, with the belief that even if she had found company, it wouldn’t have brought her solace.

B-S.highlighted_evidence: Yearning for someone to talk to or be with when I have anxiety

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I can't cope being alone yet I live alone and find no understanding or solace in others company.

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: But everyone has their own lives

timeline_summary: In this timeline, the self-states remain relatively stable, with the maladaptive voice being dominant. However, there is often a subtle adaptive self-state present, reflected in her efforts to seek help. In one post, this adaptive self-state seems to become the dominant one.
